bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 62 (Wednesday, April 10, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YOHO:H.R. 2219.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, Clause 3 of the United StatesConstitution.[Page H3257]

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

Mongolia Third Neighbor Trade Act

This bill allows the President to provide duty-free treatment for certain apparel and textile articles imported from Mongolia.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Mongolia Third Neighbor Trade Act

item.title: To promote United States-Mongolia trade by authorizing duty-free treatment for certain imports from Mongolia, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
